text.title: Not Feel Alone in Your Opinion

p.s: Have you ever felt like you have an opinion on something , but nobody else seems to agree with you ?
Do you feel alienated and unconfident as a result of this ?
A few simple tips should help !

item.s: Analyze your opinion .
How and why did you form this opinion , why do you feel so strongly about it , and why do you feel alienated for having it ?
This first step is important , because once you pinpoint exactly why your opinion is so important to you , it may become easier for you to learn how to deal with your problem .

figure.rend: Not Feel Alone in Your Opinion Step 1.jpg

item.s: Think of the number of people in the world .
There are well over 7 billion people on the planet , and it is very unlikely that your opinion on something is unique .
It is almost certain that there is at least one other person alive today that shares your opinion .

figure.rend: Not Feel Alone in Your Opinion Step 2.jpg

item.s: Go onto Google and type in how you feel about something .
To make for a better search , only use the most important keywords .
You should hopefully find at least one website which features an opinion piece submitted by someone that matches yours .

figure.rend: Not Feel Alone in Your Opinion Step 3.jpg

item.s: If you find a lot of websites like this , this can mean an excellent boost of self-confidence for you , as you may realise that you were not as alone as you thought you were .
From here , you can do extra research on the topic you have an opinion about .
Read as many websites as you can in order for you to understand and possibly accept each side to the argument , as well as the history and development of the opinion topic .
Make an opinion collage .
This involves taking screenshots of the opinions you find online on things and pasting them into a Microsoft Paint document .

figure.rend: Not Feel Alone in Your Opinion Step 4.jpg

item.s: It can be very handy to have an archive of paragraphs that you agree with , because when you feel alone once again , you can always view your opinion collage to remind yourself that there are people out there that agree with you .
Alternatively , you can add webpages featuring opinions you agree with , to your favourites for quick reference .
Join a website , such as a forum , based upon the topic you have an opinion of ( i. e. music , television , religion , politics ) .
Here , you can start a thread where you can discuss your opinion and why you feel strongly about it .
Hopefully , you will find that there are people who feel the same way and agree .
And if no-one agrees , it is still good to give your viewpoint regardless .
If it is unique , it may interest and fascinate people .

figure.rend: Not Feel Alone in Your Opinion Step 5.jpg

item.s: with satisfaction .
It always feels good to know that there are others out there who feel the same way you do about something important to you , and this can be very reassuring .

figure.rend: Not Feel Alone in Your Opinion Step 6.jpg

item.s: Remember that it is good to have an unpopular opinion .
It is all too easy to jump on the bandwagon and let others choose your opinion for you , so feel proud to have a viewpoint that differs from the norm .
It shows you have an analytical mind .
When making an opinion collage , make sure to only crop the most important parts of what you find .
That way , reading and referring to it becomes a lot easier .
Do not feel like your opinion on something is wrong if you find no one else who agrees with you .
Your opinion is your opinion , and that is all that matters in the end .
You should not let an opinion define you as a person or make you feel inferior for having it .
If you post your opinion on something online and someone responds negatively to it , do not argue with that person .
Arguing on the Internet is a waste of time , and could cost you a bad reputation .
